forge (python) signatures for fun and profit¶

Release v18.5.0 (What’s new?).

forge is an elegant Python package that allows for meta-programming of function signatures. Now, you can finally add, remove, or enhance parameters at your will.

Use it to write legible signatures for consumption by team members, the public, or other code.

Getting Started¶

TODO: forge is a Python-only package hosted on PyPI. The recommended installation method is pip-installing into a virtualenv:

$ pip install git+git://github.com/dfee/forge.git#egg=forge

Overview¶

  • Philosophy walks you through an example of forge wrapping the stdlib’s logging module. Read this to understand the value proposition, philosphy, and design strategy behind forge.
  • Basic Usage gives a comprehensive tour of forge’s features. Read this to learn how to use forge - from beginner to advanced features.
  • Advanced Usage shares some common use-cases and approaches for using forge. For example, build a function whose signature changes every call.
  • Extending demonstrates how to alter return-type annotations and add custom metadata to your parameters.
  • API Reference has documentation for all public functionality.
  • Glossary helps out iron out semantics and terms that are useful when (re-) designing function signatures.
